availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas L. Thornell (New York City Notary)

body.p: New York City, New York, clerk and notary public. New York native. Married to Rebecca Thornell. Father of Henry Thornell, William Thornell, Frederick Thornell, and Lewis Thornell. Clerk for insurance company in New York City in 1860. Second lieutenant, first lieutenant, and captain of the 22nd New York Infatnry (Co. D).

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, New York, New York City, Ward 9, District 4, p. 244; Eleventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1890), Veterans Schedule, New York, New York City, District 100, p. 12; Find A Grave, "Capt. Thomas L. Thornell (1829-1880)," Memorial #104974772, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=104974772&ref=acom (accessed March 23, 2017).
